definitions.definition: One who willingly accepts being put to death or willingly accepts challenging and exposing iniquity done to oneself for adhering openly to one's religious beliefs ; notably, saints canonized after red martyrdom .
examples: Saint Stephen was the first Christian martyr .

definitions.definition: One who sacrifices their life, station, or something of great personal value, for the sake of principle or to sustain a cause.
One who suffers greatly and/or constantly, even involuntarily.
examples: Stan is a martyr to arthritis, Chris a martyr to Stan's endless moaning about it.
labels: with a prepositional phrase of cause
definitions.label_groups: with a prepositional phrase of cause

definitions.definition: Someone who exaggerate their pain and suffering in order to gain sympathy .
examples: You have a great life! Stop trying to play the martyr !

main_definition: One who willingly accepts being put to death or willingly accepts challenging and exposing iniquity done to oneself for adhering openly to one's religious beliefs ; notably, saints canonized after red martyrdom .
secondary_definitions: ( by extension ) One who sacrifices their life, station, or something of great personal value, for the sake of principle or to sustain a cause.
( with a prepositional phrase of cause ) One who suffers greatly and/or constantly, even involuntarily.
( derogatory ) Someone who exaggerate their pain and suffering in order to gain sympathy .
